question_text: A total eclipse occurs when the observer is within the _____.
answer_explanation_text: Umbra is the region where the total eclipse takes place.

question_text: The cross-section of the objects involved in an astronomical eclipse is _____ shaped.
answer_explanation_text: The cross-section of the objects involved in an eclipse is disk-shaped.

question_text: Which eclipse is NOT safe to watch with the naked eye?
answer_explanation_text: The solar eclipse is not safe to watch with the naked eye since it can damage the vision. Exposing your eyes to the sun without proper eye protection during a solar eclipse can cause <q>eclipse blindness or retinal burns, also known as solar retinopathy. This exposure to the light can cause damage or even destroy cells in the retina (the back of the eye) that transmit what you see to the brain.

question_text: The Moon orbits the Earth in _____.
answer_explanation_text: Correct answer is C: 27.32 days. We call this side of the Moon the <q>near side, and the other side - the side we never see is the <q>far side of the Moon. This is called tidal locking of the Moon to the Earth. The Moon orbits around the Earth once every 27.3 days , which means it goes around the Earth approximately 13.37 times in 1 day .

question_text: In an eclipse where the Moon, Sun, and Earth are involved, they are nearly in a _____.
answer_explanation_text: The astronomical objects involved in eclipses like the moon, earth, and sun are aligned in a straight line.

question_text: ______ takes place when the Earth intersects the umbra portion of the Moon's shadow.
answer_explanation_text: Total solar eclipse takes place when the Earth intersects the umbra portion of the Moon's shadow.

question_text:
Consider the following statements:

1. In 2022, the lunar eclipse will also cause what is popularly known as the 'Blood Moon' phenomenon.
2. On May 16, 2022, the lunar eclipse will be the first of two lunar eclipses that are set to take place this year. The second one will take place on October 8.
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct?
answer_explanation_text: In 2022, the lunar eclipse will also cause what is popularly known as the 'Blood Moon' phenomenon. During a Blood Moon, a reddish tint is visible on the surface of the moon. This gives a unique appearance. On May 16, 2022, the lunar eclipse will be the first of two lunar eclipses that are set to take place this year. The second one will take place on November 8.

question_text: When Lunar Eclipse occur?
option_1_text: When Sun is between Earth and Moon
option_2_text: When Earth is between Sun and Moon
option_3_text: When Moon is between Earth and Sun
option_4_text: When Earth is between Sun and other celestial bodies
answer_explanation_text: A lunar eclipse occurs when Earth crosses between the moon and the sun, which casts a shadow of Earth onto the moon.

question_text: When did the lunar eclipse happen?
answer_explanation_text: Eclipses of the Moon happen at Full Moon when the Sun, Earth, and Moon are aligned to form an exact or an almost straight line.

question_text:
Select the correct option matching together about Earth shadows:

1. Umbra - darker, central part
2. Penumbra - the outer part
3. Antumbra - partly shaded area beyond the umbra
answer_explanation_text:
Explanation: Shadow of the earth is divided into three parts:
Umbra is the innermost and darkest part of the shadow and an observer experiences a total eclipse. Penumbra is the region in which only a portion of the light source is blocked by the body. Therefore, an observer experiences a partial eclipse. Antumbra is the lighter area of a shadow that appears beyond the umbra. An observer experiences an annular eclipse.

question_text: What is Solar Eclipse?
option_1_text: When the moon comes in between Earth and Sun
option_2_text: When Earth comes in between Moon and Sun
option_3_text: When Sun comes in between Earth and Moon
option_4_text: When Sun rays do not reach Earth.
answer_explanation_text:
When the moon orbits Earth, it moves between the sun and Earth. When this happens, the moon blocks the light of the sun from reaching Earth. During a solar eclipse, the moon casts a shadow on Earth.The three types of solar eclipses are:
Total Solar Eclipse: This type of solar eclipse occurs when the moon completely blocks the face of the sun while passes between the Sun and the Earth.
Annual Solar Eclipse: This type of solar eclipse occurs when the moon is at or near its farthest point from the Earth and passes between the Sun and Earth.
Partial solar eclipse: When the moon passes between the earth and the sun is not perfectly aligned in the same line, then the eclipse is known as a partial solar eclipse.

question_text: When the same pattern of solar eclipse repeats every 18 years 11 days 8 hours are known as:
answer_explanation_text: After one saros cycle of 18 years 11days 8 hours, the pattern of eclipses repeats.

question_text: What do you mean by Blood Moon?
option_1_text: It is a total solar eclipse.
option_2_text: It is a partial lunar eclipse with a red glow
option_3_text: It is a total lunar eclipse with a deep red glow
answer_explanation_text: A Total Lunar Eclipse can get a deep red glow and is sometimes called a Blood Moon.

question_text: During a lunar eclipse, the visible red colour is because of:
answer_explanation_text: Due to dust in the earth's atmosphere during the lunar eclipse red colour is seen.

question_text: Diamond ring occurs in which type of solar eclipse?
answer_explanation_text: During the total solar eclipse when the moon makes the final move over the sun, then a diamond ring structure can be observed which is known as the diamond ring effect.

question_text: Ocean tides observed at coastal locations each day are primarily caused by
option_2_text: the changing phases of the Moon
option_3_text: the gravitational attraction between the Moon and the Earth
option_4_text: seasonal changes in the compass locatin of sunrise
answer_explanation_text: Gravity is one major force that creates tides. In 1687, Sir Isaac Newton explained that ocean tides result from the gravitational attraction of the sun and moon on the oceans of the earth.

question_text: What is known as Peruvian oceanic currents?
answer_explanation_text:
The Humboldt Current, also known as the Peru Current, is a cold, low-salinity ocean current that flows north along the western coast of South America.
It is a major Eastern Boundary Upwelling System that supports high levels of primary productivity and marine biodiversity.
The current extends from the southern tip of Chile to northern Peru, bringing cold water from the deep sea to the surface, which influences local and global weather patterns.
It is named after Alexander von Humboldt, a German naturalist and explorer who described the current in the 1800s.

El-Nino: A climate phenomenon characterized by the warming of the central and eastern tropical Pacific Ocean, affecting global weather patterns.
The Benguela Current: A cold current on the west coast of Southern Africa, part of the Atlantic Ocean's subtropical gyre.
La Nina: The cooling phase of the ENSO (El Nino-Southern Oscillation), associated with cooler than average sea surface temperatures in the central and eastern Pacific Ocean.

question_text: Which of the following statements is false with regard to High tides?
option_3_text: High tides help the ships to arrive at the harbor more easily
answer_explanation_text:
The correct answer is option D) None of the Above.

-The strong gravitational pull exerted by the sun and the moon on the earth's surface cause the tides.
-High tides help in navigation.
-They raise the water level close to the shores. This helps the ships to arrive at the harbor more easily.
-The high tides also help in fishing. Many more fish come closer to the shore during the high tide. This enables fishermen to get a plentiful catch.

question_text: Oceanic tides are the smallest on the
option_3_text: 8th a day of the waxing moon.
answer_explanation_text:
This is because, during this period, the Moon and Sun are at a right angle with Earth, partially canceling each other's gravitational pull on the oceans.
This results in less pronounced high and low tides, known as neap tides.
Full moon day: This is the time of the highest tides, called spring tides, due to the combined gravitational pull of the Moon and Sun aligned with Earth.
New moon day: Same as the full moon, neap tides do not occur on the new moon day.
3rd day of the waning moon: This is not a specific timing associated with neap tides. The size of tides fluctuates throughout the lunar cycle, with neap tides occurring roughly around the first and third quarters of the moon.
Hence, we can conclude that Oceanic tides are the smallest on the 8th day of the waxing moon.

question_text: The rhythmic rise and fall of ocean water twice in a day is called ______.
answer_explanation_text:
The rhythmic rise and fall of the ocean twice a day is called a tide.
-The intense gravitational force exerted by the sun and the moon on the surface of the earth induce tides.

Additional Information:
When water covers most of the shore by rising to its maximum level, it is known as high tide.
It is low tide as the waterfalls to its lowest level and recedes from the sea.
The water of Earth closer to the moon is drawn under the influence of the gravitational force of the moon which creates a high tide.
The sun, the moon, and the earth are in the same line during the full moon and new moon days and the tides are highest. These tides are called the spring tides.
But when the moon is in its first and last quarter, the ocean waters are drawn in diagonally opposite directions through the gravitational force of the sun and earth resulting in low tides. These tides are called neap tides.
High tides help in navigation as they raise the level of water closer to the coast. This makes it easier for ships to enter the harbour.
High tides assist with fishing as well as much more fish, move closer to the sea during the high tide. This helps fishermen to have an abundant harvest.
The rise and fall of water due to tides is being used in some places to generate electricity.

question_text: Which one of the following is cold current?
answer_explanation_text:
The Atlantic Ocean is divided into two parts, by the Equatorial Counter Current, with the North(ern) Atlantic Ocean and the South(ern) the Atlantic Ocean at about 8°N.

Warm Current: North Equatorial Current
South Equatorial Current
Equatorial Counter Current
Gulf Stream
Florida Current
Brazilian Current

Cold Current: Canaries Current
Labrador Current
Falkland Current
South Atlantic Drift
Benguela Current.

question_text: The Literal meaning of the word 'Tsunami' is:?
answer_explanation_text:
Tsunami is a Japanese word with the English translation, harbour wave. Represented by two characters, the top character, tsu means harbor, while the bottom character, nami means wave.

In the past, tsunamis were sometimes referred to as tidal waves by the general public, and as seismic sea waves by the scientific community.
The term tidal wave is a misnomer; although a tsunami's impact upon a coastline is dependent upon the tidal level at the time a tsunami strikes, tsunamis are unrelated to the tides.
Tides result from the imbalanced, extraterrestrial, gravitational influences of the moon, sun, and planets. The term seismic sea wave is also misleading. Seismic implies an earthquake-related generation mechanism, but a tsunami can also be caused by a nonseismic event, such as a landslide or meteorite impact.

question_text: Which one of the following is a warm current?
answer_explanation_text:
Correct answer is C: Kuroshio current is a warm current.
A north-flowing ocean current on the west side of the North Pacific Ocean is the Kuroshio current, also known as the Japan current. It transports the warm water north to the area of Polar.
The warm waters of the Kuroshio Current sustain the coral reefs of Japan, the northernmost coral reefs in the world.
It is the western boundary current of the subtropical North Pacific gyre.
It originates from the Pacific North Equatorial Current, which divides into two on the east coast of Luzon, Philippines, to form the southward-flowing Mindanao Current and the more important northward-flowing Kuroshio Current.

Important Points:
The Canary Current is a surface current powered by wind that is part of the Gyre of the North Atlantic. This eastern boundary current branches south from the North Atlantic Current and flows southwest about as far as Senegal where it turns west and later joins the Atlantic North Equatorial Current. The current is named after the Canary Islands.
Labrador Current is a cold current that runs south from the Arctic Ocean around the Labrador coast and travels through Newfoundland, heading south down the eastern coast of Canada near Nova Scotia.
The Oyashio current in the western North Pacific Ocean is a cold subarctic ocean current that runs south and circulates counterclockwise.

question_text: Which of the following ocean currents is associated with the Indian Ocean?
answer_explanation_text:
The Agulhas Current is the western boundary current of the South Indian Ocean.
It flows down the east coast of Africa from 27°S to 40°S.

question_text: Normally, there is a ________ day interval between spring tides and neap tides.
answer_explanation_text:
There is a seven-day interval between the spring tides and neap tides.
Tides are the rise and fall of sea levels caused by the combined effects of the gravitational forces exerted by the Moon and the Sun, and the rotation of the Earth.
There are two types of tides namely, spring tides and neap tides depending upon the relative positions of the sun, the earth, and the moon.

Spring tides:
When the sun, the moon, and the earth are in a straight line, the height of the tide will be higher.
These are called spring tides and they occur twice a month, one during the full moon period and another during the new moon period.

Neap tides:
Normally, there is a seven-day interval between the spring tides and neap tides.
At this time the sun and moon are at right angles to each other and the forces of the sun and moon tend to counteract one another.
The Moon's attraction, though more than twice as strong as the sun's, is diminished by the counteracting force of the sun's gravitational pull.
Like spring tides, these tides also occur twice a month.

question_text: El Nino is a name given to the periodic development of a warm ocean current along the coast of _______.
answer_explanation_text:
El Nino is a surroundings layout that depicts the odd warming of surface waters in the Japanese tropical Pacific Ocean.
El Nino is a weather circumstance that happens in the Pacific Ocean.
The term El Nino (Spanish for 'the Christ Child') refers to a warming of the ocean surface, or above-average sea surface temperatures, in the central and eastern tropical Pacific Ocean.
The low-level surface winds, which normally blow from east to west along the equator (easterly winds), instead weaken or, in some cases, start blowing the other direction (from west to east or westerly winds).
El Nino recurs irregularly, from two years to a decade, and no two events are exactly alike. El Nino events can disrupt normal weather patterns in the United States and globally.
Los Angeles Nina is a surroundings layout that depicts the cooling of floor sea waters along the tropical west shore of South the united states.
The Mediterranean Sea envelops endless islands, a number of them being volcanic starting. The two by using a huge margin biggest islands are Sicily and Sardinia.

question_text: EI Nino is
answer_explanation_text:
Key Points:
El Nino refers to the unusual warming of the central and east-central equatorial Pacific Ocean which affects global weather.
The warmer waters of the Pacific Ocean cause the winds in various regions to reverse, like the trade winds that come towards India.
This change of wind direction leads to warmer winters and summers and a decrease in rainfall during the monsoon.
Most of the time, it also leads to drought.

Effects of El Nino:
?El Nino affects global weather.
It favors eastern Pacific hurricanes and tropical storms.
Recorded unusual rainfall in Peru, Chile, and Ecuador are linked to the climate pattern.
Over India, the El Nino has usually been the harbinger of drought and the La Nina of rain.

Important Points:
There is also an opposite of an El Nino, called La Nina means The Little Girl in Spanish.
This refers to times when waters of the tropical eastern Pacific are colder than normal and trade winds blow more strongly than usual.
Collectively, El Nino and La Nina are parts of an oscillation in the ocean-atmosphere system called the El Nino-Southern Oscillation, or ENSO cycle.
